active.description: If a scheduled downtime currently exists.

active_child.description: The downtime object definition of the active child for the original parent recurring downtime.

canceled.description: If a scheduled downtime is canceled.

creator_id.description: User ID of the downtime creator.

disabled.description: If a downtime has been disabled.

downtime_type.description: 0 for a downtime applied on * or all, 1 when the downtime is only scoped to hosts, or 2 when the downtime is scoped to anything but hosts.

end.description: POSIX timestamp to end the downtime. If not provided, the downtime is in effect indefinitely until you cancel it.

message.description: A message to include with notifications for this downtime.

monitor_id.description: A single monitor to which the downtime applies. If not provided, the downtime applies to all monitors.

monitor_tags.description: A comma-separated list of monitor tags.

mute_first_recovery_notification.description: If the first recovery notification during a downtime should be muted.

recurrence.description: An object defining the recurrence of the downtime.

scope.description: The scope(s) to which the downtime applies.

start.description: POSIX timestamp to start the downtime. If not provided, the downtime starts the moment it is created.

timezone.description: The timezone in which to display the downtime's start and end times in Datadog applications.

updater_id.description: ID of the last user that updated the downtime.
